job_description: Example Company - A leading tech firm specializing in innovative solutions. About Example Company: We create cutting-edge software that transforms how businesses operate. Our collaborative environment encourages creativity and professional growth. The Role: As a Full-Stack Developer, you'll work on all aspects of our web applications, from database design to user interface implementation. Key Responsibilities: Develop and maintain web applications using modern frameworks. Collaborate with UX/UI designers to implement responsive interfaces. Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code. Participate in code reviews and technical discussions. What We're Looking For: Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field. Experience with JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Node.js. Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases. Bonus Points: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). What We Offer: Competitive salary: $90,000-$120,000 depending on experience. Flexible working hours and remote options. Health insurance and 401(k) matching. Professional development opportunities. How to Apply: Send your resume to careers@example.com. Include links to your GitHub profile or portfolio.

technical_skills.description: Evaluate technical knowledge of JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Node.js, and database systems. Consider familiarity with modern development practices and tools.

experience.description: Consider previous experience developing full-stack applications. Assess complexity of past projects and responsibilities in previous roles.

problem_solving.description: Evaluate analytical thinking and approach to technical challenges. Look for evidence of innovative solutions and debugging skills.

education.description: Assess formal education in Computer Science or related fields, as well as relevant certifications and continuing education.

communication.description: Evaluate ability to communicate technical concepts clearly. Consider experience working in teams and collaborating with non-technical stakeholders.
